title: Morello you asked

embed.description: Lead designer at Riot Games Ryan "Morello" Scott took to the stage last week to kick off the first ever esports summit at this year's Game Developer's Conference in San Francisco. His panel, "Building a Sport: The Design Philosophy of League of Legends," outlined the design team's mission of balancing depth and complexity while still maintaining accessibility and fun.

body:
"Why do we continue to see non-supports roaming in bottom lane?"

Because for some reason, Supports have to have shit stats. Shit bases, Shit scaling.

They are not allowed to go into any other lane, If they somehow manage it (Lulu top, Ali jungle, Anyone can add to this list it gos on and on) They are nerfed into hell. 

Support mages at this point tend to fill the role better. Because Better base stats, Better scaling, Better base damage. (And in most cases) Lower cds.

Except Ali jungle was nightmare fuel and Lulu solo lane was a terror for anyone to deal with. Most supports when they are able to go into other lanes and do well tend to outperform by miles anyone else, which is why they get nerfed so often when they do well in solo lanes.
While I do dislike that non-supports becoming supports, it's not like they are completely pushing traditional supports out of the role. If anything, they are adding more diversity to the role (which is what you argue for with supports being able to go into solo lanes, but I digress)

I've seen almost every stage of the game's (glorious?) evolution and trust me when I tell you supports are rewarded MUCH more now than they were back in the day.

Sona gives a good move speed boost yes, But the area given in is tiny, The heal feel meh, The sheild is better. Her poke is okay, But doesn't make up for the fact that she's the Squishiest champion in the game.

Remember when Janna passive/Zil passive were global? Remember when they changed to to "Near" Now janna only give it to you when you're move TOWARDS her.

I remember playing mid Soraka and having fun with it. I remember going Ashe Mid, So on so forth. 

This doesn't change the fact that supports have been all around nerfed again and again and again to keep them from going to other lanes. Where as other lanes are allowed to roam between 2-3 roles. (Sometimes 4 Cho)

Has there ever been a time when people liked supports going into other lanes? When lulu was strong top, there were tons of threads complaining about her. It's not that their being kept in one role because their supports, it's because no one likes playing against them when their somewhere else. 

Anyways, Sona isn't the squishiest champion in the game.
And I'm sorry, but just because their supports, doesn't mean they should be free from nerfs. Most of the first batches of champions have been overall nerfed from release, don't act like they specifically targeted Janna. She was OP back then, Yeah, supports may be overall worse compared to their S1/S2 selves, but almost all champions are worse when you're comparing it that way.
Soraka would have been in a better spot if riot didn't link her Q and W in season four and would have never gotten to be so toxic.
